intro: Theligonum cynocrambe f. vulgare, commonly known as the common yellow wood-sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It features trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a fibrous root system. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and shaded areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
